channel.title: CVE Feed for PHPGurukul -- Job Portal
channel.description: The latest CVEs for PHPGurukul -- Job Portal

item.title: CVE-2024-8472|2024-09-05T13:28:45.886Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability, whereby user-controlled input is not sufficiently encrypted. Exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to retrieve the session details of an authenticated user through multiple parameters in /jobportal/index.php.

item.title: CVE-2024-8464|2024-09-05T13:24:06.728Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: SQL injection vulnerability, by which an attacker could send a specially designed query through JOBREGID parameter in /jobportal/admin/applicants/controller.php, and retrieve all the information stored in it.

item.title: CVE-2024-8471|2024-09-05T13:29:09.863Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability, whereby user-controlled input is not sufficiently encrypted. Exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to retrieve the session details of an authenticated user through JOBID and USERNAME parameters in /jobportal/process.php.

item.title: CVE-2024-8468|2024-09-05T13:15:13.688Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: SQL injection vulnerability, by which an attacker could send a specially designed query through search parameter in /jobportal/index.php, and retrieve all the information stored in it.

item.title: CVE-2024-8473|2024-09-05T13:27:17.329Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability, whereby user-controlled input is not sufficiently encrypted. Exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to retrieve the session details of an authenticated user through user_email parameter in /jobportal/admin/login.php.

item.title: CVE-2024-8466|2024-09-05T13:21:56.302Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: SQL injection vulnerability, by which an attacker could send a specially designed query through CATEGORY parameter in /jobportal/admin/category/controller.php, and retrieve all the information stored in it.

item.title: CVE-2024-8463|2024-09-05T13:25:59.317Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: File upload restriction bypass vulnerability in PHPGurukul Job Portal 1.0, the exploitation of which could allow an authenticated user to execute an RCE via webshell.

item.title: CVE-2024-8467|2024-09-05T13:18:18.565Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: SQL injection vulnerability, by which an attacker could send a specially designed query through id parameter in /jobportal/admin/category/index.php, and retrieve all the information stored in it.

item.title: CVE-2024-8470|2024-09-05T13:12:37.209Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: SQL injection vulnerability, by which an attacker could send a specially designed query through CATEGORY parameter in /jobportal/admin/vacancy/controller.php, and retrieve all the information stored in it.

item.description: SQL injection vulnerability, by which an attacker could send a specially designed query through id parameter in /jobportal/admin/employee/index.php, and retrieve all the information stored in it.

item.title: CVE-2024-8465|2024-09-05T13:22:57.789Z -- phpgurukul -- job%20portal
item.description: SQL injection vulnerability, by which an attacker could send a specially designed query through user_id parameter in /jobportal/admin/user/controller.php, and retrieve all the information stored in it.
